info.title: Device, Broker and Value Mgmt API

get.summary: Insert, update, delete, retrieve devices and device information.
get.description:
This API is for managing the IoT devices. It can be used for inserting, updating, deleting, and retrieving information about a device of interest. 

An Authorization header in Bearer format must be sent, including an access or a refresh token (see the _nodered_ parameter below).

The __action__ input parameter indicates which operation has to be performed:

* __Insert__ - This API is intended to insert a new device in the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned. This operation also provides the registration in the Knowledge Base, and in the specified context broker (when the context broker requires a specific registration).  

* __Update__ - This API is intended to update a device in the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. _Remark: if you omit to submit optional parameters, they are set to their default values or removed, they do not keep their old values._ The status of the operation is returned. This operation also provides the updating in the Knowledge base and the updating in the specified context broker.

* __Delete__ - This API is intended to delete a device from the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned. This operation also provides the deletion from the Knowledge base and the deletion from corresponding context broker.

* __Change visibility__ - This API is intended to change the visibility of the device. A device can be public (all users can see it), private (only the owner can see it) and delegated (only the owner user and a groups or user  chosen). Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned.

* __Change owner__ - This API is intended to change the owner of the device. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned.

* __Get All Devices__ - This API is intended to retrieve all device from the Iot-Directory. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Get Delegations__ - This API is intended to retrieve the delegation of a device from the Iot-Directory. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Add Delegations__ - This API is intended to add a delegation to a device. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.


* __Remove Delegations__ - This API is intended to remove the delegation of a device. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.  

* __Get Device Attributes__ - This API is intended to retrieve all the values associated with devices from the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Loading value__ - This API is intended to retrieve all the values associated with attributes of a specific devices in that  specific moment. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Insert value__ - This API is intended to insert  all or a subset values associated with attributes of a specific devices. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Get Device__ - This API is intended to retrieve all available information about the specified Device. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Download__ - This API is intended to retrieve the private key / certificate of a Device created with Authentication factor. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Get available static attribute__ - This API is intended to retrieve the static attributes given a subnature. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
The operation to be performed.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, delete, get_device_attributes.

parameters.name: nodered
parameters.description: If this parameter is present (the value doesn't actually matter), the token sent through the Authorization header is interpreted as an access token, otherwise it is interpreted as a refresh token.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the device (in the specified context broker). It has to be conformant to regex: /[a-zA-Z0-9_-]/ (if the device is imported from an external source, colons can also be used)

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, delete, get_device_attributes, get_device, download, insert_Value, Loading_value, get_delegation, remove__delegation, add_delegation.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of the device (e.g. Thermometer, TrainPass, Citylamp, fan). It cannot be modified in update.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: contextbroker
parameters.description:
Name of the context broker that handles the device. It has to be conformant to regex: /[a-zA-Z0-9_-]/

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, delete, get_device_attributes, get_device, download.

parameters.name: start_time , end_time
parameters.description:
These values create an inclusive range that expression is compared to the date of creation of device.

_Required for actions:_ get_all_devices.

parameters.name: gb_old_cb
parameters.description:
Name of the old context broker (if changed).

If the context broker is not changed, set this parameter to an empty string.

_Required for actions:_ update.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description:
It specifies if the device is a sensor or an actuator.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
Format of the value that the device accepts or produces.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description:
Latitude coordinate of the device location.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description:
Longitude coordinate of the device location.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description:
Frequency at which observations are produced, in seconds.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description:
A JSON array of objects each representing a kind of value (attribute) that the device accepts (actuator) or produces (sensor). The value_name has to be conformant to regex: /[a-zA-Z0-9_-]/
and is composed by:

* __value_name__: Name of the measured value
* __data_type__: Data type measured(int, float, ecc) based on the dictionary
* __value_type__: Type of value measured based on the dictionary
* __editable__: Flag to indicate if a value is editable
* __value_unit__: Unit of measurement of the value based on the dictionary 
* __healthiness_criteria__: Criteria to decide if an attribute is healthy
* __healthiness_value__: Time in seconds to decide if an attribute is healthy
* __real_time_flag__: Flag "true" or "false" to indicate if a value is measured in realtime (if true updates are sent over kafka and websocket connection) default "false"

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

_Example:_

[
  {
    "value_name": "humidity",
    "data_type": "float",
    "value_type": "humidity",
    "editable": "0",
    "value_unit": "%",
    "healthiness_criteria": "refresh_rate",
    "healthiness_value": "300"
    "real_time_flag": "true"
  },
  
  {
    "value_name": "temperature",
    "data_type": "float",
    "value_type": "temperature",
    "editable": "0",
    "value_unit": "째C",
    "healthiness_criteria": "refresh_rate",
    "healthiness_value": "300"
  }
]

parameters.name: producer
parameters.description:
Device producer. 

It can be set to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description:
Device model. 

If specified, it has to be conformant to regex: /[a-zA-Z0-9_-]/ but it also can include white spaces. 

Set it to "custom" if the device is not created from a model.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: k1
parameters.description:
It specifies the first part of the secret in case the device is of a protected model. 

It can be set to an empty string if not applicable.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: k2
parameters.description:
It specifies the second part of the secret in case the device is of a protected model. 

It can be set to an empty string if not applicable.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description:
Relative path and filename of the certificate file to be downloaded from the server.

_Required in actions:_ download.

_Examples:_

/private/prova-modello2-cert-key.pem 

/certsdb/prova-modello2-cert-crt.pem

parameters.name: highleveltype
parameters.description:
Additional type in addition to the subnature

Available High level types:
* iot_device_entity
* Heatmap
* Traffic_flow
* OriginDestinationMatrix
* Trajectory_path
* Gardens
* Building_plant
* Building
* Floor
* Cycling_paths

parameters.name: wktGeometry
parameters.description:
Vector geometry for the device (not required when highleveltype is "iot_device_entity")

Supported Wkt objects:
* POINT
* LINESTRING 
* POLYGON 
* MULTIPOINT 
* MULTILINESTRING 
* MULTIPOLYGON 
* GEOMETRYCOLLECTION

parameters.name: own, public, delegated
parameters.description:
These parameters filter the devices. _OWN_ : keep only the own devices; _PUBLIC_ : kepp only public devices; _DELEGATED_ : kepp only delegated devices. If an user want own and delegated devices can set to true the parameters: own and delegated.

_Required in actions:_ get_all_device.

parameters.name: deleteattributes
parameters.description:
The new list of the device attributes is composed starting from those specified in the _attributes_ parameter, then adding those specified in the _newattributes_ parameter, finally removing those specified in this _deleteattributes_ parameter. The value_name has to be conformant to regex: /[a-zA-Z0-9_-]/
and is composed by:

* __value_name__: Name of the measured value
* __data_type__: Data type measured(int, float, ecc) based on the dictionary
* __value_type__: Type of value measured based on the dictionary
* __editable__: Flag to indicate if a value is editable
* __value_unit__: Unit of measurement of the value based on the dictionary 
* __healthiness_criteria__: Criteria to decide if an attribute is healthy
* __healthiness_value__: Time in seconds to decide if an attribute is healthy
* __real_time_flag__: Flag to indicate if a value is measured in realtime

_Used in actions:_ update.

_Example:_

[
  {
    "value_name": "humidity",
    "data_type": "float",
    "value_type": "humidity",
    "editable": "0",
    "value_unit": "%",
    "healthiness_criteria": "refresh_rate",
    "healthiness_value": "300"
  },
  {
    "value_name": "temperature",
    "data_type": "float",
    "value_type": "temperature",
    "editable": "0",
    "value_unit": "째C",
    "healthiness_criteria": "refresh_rate",
    "healthiness_value": "300"
  }
]

parameters.name: newattributes
parameters.description:
The new list of the device attributes is composed starting from those specified in the _attributes_ parameter, then adding those specified in this _newattributes_ parameter, finally removing those specified in the _deleteattributes_ parameter. The value_name has to be conformant to regex: /[a-zA-Z0-9_-]/
and is composed by:

* __value_name__: Name of the measured value
* __data_type__: Data type measured(int, float, ecc) based on the dictionary
* __value_type__: Type of value measured based on the dictionary
* __editable__: Flag to indicate if a value is editable
* __value_unit__: Unit of measurement of the value based on the dictionary 
* __healthiness_criteria__: Criteria to decide if an attribute is healthy
* __healthiness_value__: Time in seconds to decide if an attribute is healthy
* __real_time_flag__: Flag to indicate if a value is measured in realtime
 
 _Used in actions:_ update.
 
 _Example:_
 
 [
   {
     "value_name": "humidity",
     "data_type": "float",
     "value_type": "humidity",
     "editable": "0",
     "value_unit": "%",
     "healthiness_criteria": "refresh_rate",
     "healthiness_value": "300"
   },
   {
     "value_name": "temperature",
     "data_type": "float",
     "value_type": "temperature",
     "editable": "0",
     "value_unit": "째C",
     "healthiness_criteria": "refresh_rate",
     "healthiness_value": "300"
   }
 ]

parameters.name: mac
parameters.description:
Mac address of the device. 

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: shouldbeRegistered
parameters.description:
If the parameter is set to "yes", the device is registered in KB. 

It defaults to "yes".

_Used in actions:_ insert.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description:
In case of a multi-tenant context broker, it specifies the name of the Tenant to be used. 

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update, delete, get_device_attributes, get_device.

parameters.name: servicePath
parameters.description:
In case of a multi-tenant context broker, it specifies the path to be used. 

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update, delete, get_device_attributes, get_device.

parameters.name: subnature
parameters.description:
KB Classification of the device. 

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: static_attributes
parameters.description:
A JSON array of arrays each representing a static attribute of the device.

For each static attribute the key (URI) and the value must be specified.
It defaults to an empty array.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

_Example:_ [["http://schema.org/addressLocality","Firenze"],["http://schema.org/addressRegion","Toscana"]]

parameters.name: length
parameters.description:
The number of the results that are to be returned at maximum.

It is used for pagination. It sets the page size.

It defaults to -1, which means that all results must be returned.

_Used in actions:_ get_all_device.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description:
1-based index of the first entry to be returned. 

It is only used in case of pagination (parameter _length_ submitted and greater than -1). 

_Used in actions:_ get_all_device.

parameters.name: draw
parameters.description:
See the the DataTable documentation at 

https://datatables.net/manual/server-side#Returned-data 

to learn more about the draw parameter.  

_Used in actions:_ get_all_device.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description:
__DEPRECATED__ 

It specifies for internal purposes of the Iot-Directory if the IoT Device is Public or Private. 

It defaults to "private".

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: edgegateway_type
parameters.description:
__DEPRECATED__ 

Type of edge device. 

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: edgegateway_uri
parameters.description:
__DEPRECATED__ 

URL of edge device. 

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

get.summary: Insert, update, delete, retrieve models and model information.
get.description:
This API is for managing the IoT models. It can be used for inserting, updating, deleting, and retrieving information about a model of interest. 

An Authorization header in Bearer format must be sent, including an access or a refresh token (see the _nodered_ parameter below).

The __action__ input parameter indicates which operation has to be performed:

* __Insert__ - This API is intended to insert a new model in the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned.  

* __Update__ - This API is intended to update a model in the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned. 

* __Delete__ - This API is intended to delete a model from the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned. 

* __Get All Models__ - This API is intended to retrieve all models from the Iot-Directory. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Get Value Attributes__ - This API is intended to retrieve all kinds of value associated with a model stored in the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Get Model__ - This API is intended to retrieve all available information about the specified model. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Get FIWIRE Model__ - This API is intended to retrieve all available information about the specified smart data model of FIWARE. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Update values of FIWIRE Model__ - This API is intended to aupdate a value or a subset of values of a Smart Data Model's attribute. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Get All Models DataTable__ - __DEPRECATED (use _Get all models_ instead)__ This API is intended to retrieve all models from the Iot-Directory in a paginated way. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
The operation to be performed.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, delete, get_model, get_value_attributes, get_all_models, get_all_models_DataTable.

parameters.name: nodered
parameters.description: If this parameter is present (the value doesn't actually matter), the token provided through the Authorization header is interpreted as an access token, otherwise it is interpreted as a refresh token.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Unique name for the model. 

_Required for actions:_  insert, update, get_model.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description:
Description for the model. 

It can be set to an empty string.

_Required for actions:_  insert, update.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the model. It must conform to the regex: /[a-zA-Z0-9_-]/ 

_Required for actions:_  update, delete, get_value_attribute, Update_values_attributes_FIWIRE, get_value_attributes_FIWIRE.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of the model (e.g. Thermometer, TrainPass, Citylamp, fan).

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description:
The version of the Smart Data Model .

_Required for actions:_ Update_values_attributes_FIWIRE , get_value_attributes_FIWIRE .

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description:
The domain of the Smart Data Model .

_Required for actions:_ Update_values_attributes_FIWIRE , get_value_attributes_FIWIRE .

parameters.name: subdomain
parameters.description:
The subdomain of the Smart Data Model .

_Required for actions:_ Update_values_attributes_FIWIRE , get_value_attributes_FIWIRE .

parameters.name: change
parameters.description:
The payload with the proposed change of the Smart Data Model's attribute .

_Required for actions:_ Update_values_attributes_FIWIRE.

parameters.name: contextbroker
parameters.description:
Name of the context broker that handles the device. It must conform to the regex: /[a-zA-Z0-9_-]/

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description:
It specifies if the model is for a sensor or an actuator.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
Format of the values that are accepted (actuator) or produced (sensors) by the devices that conform to the inserting/updating model.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description:
Frequency at which observations are produced, in seconds.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: kgenerator
parameters.description:
Type of authentication.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description:
A JSON array of objects representing each a kind of values accepted (actuators) or generated (sensors) by the devices that conform to the inserting/updating model. The value_name must conform to regex: /[a-zA-Z0-9_-]/ and is composed by:

* __value_name__: Name of the measured value
* __data_type__: Data type measured(int, float, ecc) based on the dictionary
* __value_type__: Type of value measured based on the dictionary
* __editable__: Flag to indicate if a value is editable
* __value_unit__: Unit of measurement of the value based on the dictionary 
* __healthiness_criteria__: Criteria to decide if an attribute is healthy
* __healthiness_value__: Time in seconds to decide if an attribute is healthy
* __real_time_flag__: Flag to indicate if a value is measured in realtime

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

_Example:_

[
  {
    "value_name": "humidity",
    "data_type": "float",
    "value_type": "humidity",
    "editable": "0",
    "value_unit": "%",
    "healthiness_criteria": "refresh_rate",
    "healthiness_value": "300",
    "real_time_flag":"true"
  },
  {
    "value_name": "temperature",
    "data_type": "float",
    "value_type": "temperature",
    "editable": "0",
    "value_unit": "째C",
    "healthiness_criteria": "refresh_rate",
    "healthiness_value": "300",
    "real_time_flag":"true"
  }
]

parameters.name: producer
parameters.description:
Device producer

It can be set to an empty string if not available.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: hc
parameters.description:
__DEPRECATED__

Healthiness criteria 

Model attributes bear this information in new models. Despite mandatory, this parameter should be set to an empty string for new models.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: hv
parameters.description:
__DEPRECATED__

Healthiness value

Model attributes bear this information in new models. Despite mandatory, this parameter should be set to an empty string for new models.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: highleveltype
parameters.description:
Additional type in addition to the subnature

Available High level types:
* iot_device_entity
* Heatmap
* Traffic_flow
* OriginDestinationMatrix
* Trajectory_path
* Gardens
* Building_plant
* Building
* Floor
* Cycling_paths

parameters.name: service
parameters.description:
In case of a multi-tenant context broker, it specifies the name of the Tenant to be used. 

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: servicePath
parameters.description:
In case of a multi-tenant context broker, it specifies the path to be used. 

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: subnature
parameters.description:
KB classification of the device. 

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: static_attributes
parameters.description:
A JSON array of arrays each representing a static attribute of the device. For each static attribute, the key and the default value must be specified. 

It defaults to an empty array.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

_Example:_ [["http://schema.org/addressLocality","Firenze"]]

parameters.name: edgegateway_type
parameters.description:
__DEPRECATED__ 

Type of edge device. 

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description:
__DEPRECATED (use Get all models instead)__

The number of the results that are to be returned at maximum.

It is used for pagination. It sets the page size.

It defaults to -1, which means that all results must be returned.

_Used in actions:_ get_all_models_DataTable.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description:
__DEPRECATED (use Get all models instead)__

1-based index of the first entry to be returned. 

Used only in case of pagination (parameter _length_ submitted and greater than -1). 

It defaults to 1. 

_Used in actions:_ get_all_models_DataTable.

parameters.name: draw
parameters.description:
__DEPRECATED (use Get all models instead)__

See the the DataTable documentation at 

https://datatables.net/manual/server-side#Returned-data 

to learn more about the draw parameter.  

It defaults to 1.

_Used in actions:_ get_all_models_DataTable.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description:
__DEPRECATED (use Get all models instead)__

Array of the columns to be returned.

It defaults to an empty array.

_Used in actions:_ get_all_models_DataTable.

get.summary: Insert, update, delete, retrieve context brokers and context broker information
get.description:
This API is for the management of the context brokers. It allows to insert, update, delete, get the full listing of the brokers. The __action__ input parameter indicates the operation to be performed:

* __Insert__ - This API is intended to insert a new Context Broker in the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned.

* __Update__ - This API is intended to update a Context Broker in the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned. 

* __Delete__ - This API is intended to delete a Context Broker from the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned. 

* __Get All Context Brokers__ - This API is intended to retrieve all Context Brokers from the Iot-Directory. No additional parameters are needed for this operation. The status of the operation is returned, together with the requested data.

* __Get Services By CB Name__ - This API is intended to get information about the services offered by a Context Broker, in the specific case in which it supports the NGSI with multitenancy. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned, together with the requested data.

* __Is Broker Up__ - This API verifies that the given context broker is up and running by submitting an HTTP request to its /v2/entities path for version 2, or to /v1/queryContext for version 1.

* __Update Orion version__ - This API verifies that the given context broker has updated version of Orion.

* __Get specific contextbroker__ - This API is intended to get information about the Context Broker, given the subscrition id. The information contemplates the resource link.

* __Take a default CB__ - This API is intended to get a ready-to-use Orion Context Broker. The result give all the information about the Context Broker.

* __Get Orion version__ - This API is intended to get the Orion version about the Context Broker, given the id. 

* __Change visibility__ - This API is intended to change the visibility of the Context Broker. A Context Broker can be public (all users can see it), private (only the owner can see it) and delegated (only the owner user and a groups or user  chosen). Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned.

* __Change owner__ - This API is intended to change the owner of the Context Broker. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned.

* __Get Delegations__ - This API is intended to retrieve the delegation of a Context Broker from the Iot-Directory. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Add Delegations__ - This API is intended to add a delegation to a Context Broker. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

* __Remove Delegations__ - This API is intended to remove the delegation of a Contex Broker. The status of the operation is returned together with the requested data.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The operation to be performed.

parameters.name: nodered
parameters.description: If this parameter is present (the value doesn't actually matter), the token submitted through the Authorization header is interpreted as an access token, otherwise it is interpreted as a refresh token.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
Name of the Context Broker that handles different devices. It is a unique identifier.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, delete, get_services_by_cb_name, update_orion, orion_version, get_delegations, change_visibility, change_owner.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description:
Kind of the Context Broker.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description:
The Internet Protocol (IP) address of the Context Broker.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description:
The port number of the Context Broker.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description:
The communication protocol supported by the Context Broker.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description:
Latitude coordinate of the Context Broker location (when available, otherwise an empty string).

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description:
Longitude coordinate of the Context Broker location (when available, otherwise an empty string).

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: contextbroker
parameters.description:
Visibility of the Context Broker.

_Required in actions:_ is_broker_up

parameters.name: version
parameters.description:
The version of the communication protocol supported by the Context Broker.

_Required in actions_: is_broker_up

__Deprecated for actions: insert, update__

parameters.name: sub_ID
parameters.description:
The subscription ID of the Context broker.

_Required in actions_: get_specific_contextbroker

Deprecated for actions: insert, update, delete, get_all_contextbroker, get_services_by_cb_name, is_broker_up

parameters.name: login
parameters.description:
Login name for authenticating to the Context Broker for the Internal scenario. 

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description:
Login password for authenticating to the Context Broker for the Internal scenario.

It defaults to an empty string.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: sha
parameters.description:
SHA of the Broker's certificate.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: accesslink
parameters.description:
URL to contact the Context Broker from the external.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: accessport
parameters.description:
Port to contact the Context Broker from the external.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description:
Path to contact the Context Broker.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update, is_broker_up.

parameters.name: services
parameters.description:
The list of the available services, only needed for Context Brokers that support NGSI with multitenancy.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update, is_broker_up.

parameters.name: urlnificallback
parameters.description:
For internal NGSI Context Brokers, it is possible to specify a callback URL where to receive push updates at every new content published to the broker. 

_See also:_ https://www.snap4city.org/drupal/node/562

_Used in actions:_ insert, update.

parameters.description:
__DEPRECATED__

Visibility of the Context Broker.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update, change_visibility.

parameters.name: org
parameters.description:
Organization of the Context Broker.

_Used in actions:_ insert, update, update_orion,Orion_version.

get.summary: Insert, update, delete, retrieve values and value information.
get.description:
This API is for the management of the event values. It allows to insert, update, delete, get the full listing of the event values, and check value informations. The __action__ input parameter indicates the operation to be performed:

* __Insert__ - This API is intended to insert a new value with a device already registered in the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned. This operation also provides the registration in the Knowledge Base. The value is also reported in the structure of the device registered in the Context Broker (when this is required by the Context Broker).

* __Update__ - This API is intended to update a value with a device already registered in the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned. This operation also provides the updating on the Knowledge Base. The value is also reported in the structure of the device registered in the Context Broker (when this is required by the Context Broker).

* __Delete__ - This API is intended to delete a value from the Iot-Directory. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned. This operation also provides the deletion from the Knowledge Base.  

* __Get All Event Values__ - This API is intended to retrieve all values from the Iot-Directory. No additional parameters are needed. The status of the operation is returned, together with the requested data. 

* __Check If Last Value__ - This API is intended to retrieve the number of the values of a specific device. Read thoroughly the _Parameters_ section below here to learn about the mandatory and optional parameters for this specific operation. The status of the operation is returned.

* __Get all temporary event value for registered devices__

* __Update temporary event values for registered devices__

* __Delete temporary event values for registered devices__

* __Insert all valid event values__

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The operation to be performed.

parameters.name: nodered
parameters.description: If this parameter is present (the value doesn't actually matter), the token submitted through the Authorization header is intepreted as an access token, otherwise as a refresh token.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description:
Unique identifier of the device.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, delete, check_if_last_value, update_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices, delete_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: contextbroker
parameters.description:
Name of the Context Broker that handles the device.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, delete, check_if_last_value, update_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices, delete_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: value_name
parameters.description:
Name of the value.

The name of the value is unique given the device and the context broker.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, delete, update_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices, delete_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: data_type
parameters.description:
Data type of the value (e.g. integer, float, string, boolean, and so on).

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, update_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: value_type
parameters.description:
Type of the value (e.g. Temperature, humidity, light, CO_concentration, and so on).

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, update_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: value_unit
parameters.description:
Unit of measure of the value (eg. 째C,  %, lux, ppm, and so on).

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, update_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: editable
parameters.description:
It specifies if the measure can be only read (0) or a value can be assigned (1). 

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, delete, update_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: healthiness_criteria
healthiness_value
parameters.description:
Healthiness value related to the healthiness criteria. The interpretetation varies depending of the adopted healthiness criteria: it could be the expected frequency of generation of new values (e.g. 300 seconds), the maximum number of identical consecutive values, or the minimum and maximum allowed values.

_Required for actions:_ insert, update, update_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: real_time_flag
parameters.description:
It indicates if the values are measured in real time

Required for actions: insert, update, update_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices.

Available values : true,false

parameters.name: old_value_name
parameters.description:
Old name of the value.

_Required for actions:_  update_temporary_event_values_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: listAttributes
parameters.description:
List of the attributes.

It is expected to be a string serialization of a JSON array of objects each having properties _contextbroker_, _device_, and _attribute_. The attribute is expected to be again an object with properties: value_name, data_type, value_type, editable, value_unit, healthiness_criteria, healthiness_value.

_Required for actions:_ insert_all_valid_event_values

parameters.name: length
parameters.description:
The number of the results that are to be returned at maximum.

It is used for pagination. It sets the page size.

It defaults to -1, which means that all results must be returned.

_Used in actions:_ get_all_event_value, get_all_temporary_event_value_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description:
1-based index of the first entry to be returned.

It is only used in case of pagination (parameter _length_ submitted and greater than -1).

It defaults to 1.

_Used in actions:_ get_all_event_value, get_all_temporary_event_value_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: draw
parameters.description:
See the the DataTable documentation at 

https://datatables.net/manual/server-side#Returned-data 

to learn more about the draw parameter.  

It defaults to 1.

_Used in actions:_ get_all_event_value, get_all_temporary_event_value_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description:
Array of the columns to be returned.

It defaults to an empty array.

_Used in actions:_ get_all_event_value, get_all_temporary_event_value_for_registered_devices.

parameters.name: select
parameters.description:
String serialization of a JSON array of objects each representing a filter to be applied.

It defaults to an empty array.

_Used in actions:_ get_all_temporary_event_value_for_registered_devices.

attribute.description: A type of detection that a device is capable to perform.

data_type.description: Basic type of the value (e.g. string, integer).

value_type.description: A semantic description of the value.

editable.description: If the value can be only read or its value can be also updated.

value_unit.description: Unit of measure of the value.

healthiness_criteria.description: How the healthy status of the device should be determined.

device.description: JSON document where the status of the operation and the possible retrieved data can be found.
